meanings.definition: Distance east or west on the earth's surface, measured in degrees from the prime meridian at Greenwich, England.
meanings.sent1: The ship's captain used the longitude to navigate across the vast ocean.
meanings.sent2: The map displayed the longitude lines running vertically from north to south.
meanings.sent3: The longitude decided which way the ship would sail, much to the crew's surprise.
meanings.sent4: His sense of longitude was so accurate, it was like having a built-in GPS.
meanings.sent5: The longitude marking on the globe made it easy to pinpoint exact locations.
